Author: ravenslofty
Content: yes and no.

Author: ravenslofty
Content: the "source" of the gates is gonna be the spice simulation models

Author: ravenslofty
Content: but...two transistors in parallel behave identically to a single transistor that is twice as wide

Author: ravenslofty
Content: and this isn't just theoretical

Author: ravenslofty
Content:
```
.SUBCKT gf180mcu_fd_sc_mcu7t5v0__inv_1 I ZN VDD VNW VPW VSS
X_i_0 ZN I VSS VPW nfet_05v0 W=8.2e-07 L=6e-07
X_i_1 ZN I VDD VNW pfet_05v0 W=1.22e-06 L=5e-07
.ENDS
```
here's a size-1 inverter

Author: ravenslofty
Content:
```
.SUBCKT gf180mcu_fd_sc_mcu7t5v0__inv_2 I ZN VDD VNW VPW VSS
X_i_0_0 ZN I VSS VPW nfet_05v0 W=8.2e-07 L=6e-07
X_i_0_1 VSS I ZN VPW nfet_05v0 W=8.2e-07 L=6e-07
X_i_1_0 ZN I VDD VNW pfet_05v0 W=1.22e-06 L=5e-07
X_i_1_1 VDD I ZN VNW pfet_05v0 W=1.22e-06 L=5e-07
.ENDS
```
here's a size-2 inverter

Author: ravenslofty
Content: so, do we say that the size-2 inverter has 4 transistors and the size-1 inverter has 2?

Author: ravenslofty
Content: even though the size-2 inverter can be implemented with 2 transistors of twice the width?

Author: ravenslofty
Content: I don't know, I think "number of transistors" is not a useful metric
